DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate feasibility social medium text-message-delivered , Social Cognitive Theory-based , culturally relevant intervention design promote physical activity among African American woman . An 8-week , 2-arm randomize trial implement . Arm 1 receive culturally-relevant , technology-based physical activity intervention deliver via Facebook text message . Arm 2 ( Comparison Group ) receive standard print-based physical activity promotion material consist high quality physical activity promotion brochure produce American Heart Association .
DOC.brief_title: Facebook Promote Physical Activity Black Women African American Women
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study apply investigate feasibility social medium text-message-delivered , Social Cognitive Theory-based , culturally relevant intervention design promote physical activity among African American woman . In 8-week , 2-arm randomized trial , 30 African American woman assign receive either : ) culturally-relevant , technology-based physical activity intervention deliver via Facebook text message , b ) standard print-based physical activity promotion intervention consist high quality physical activity promotion brochure produce American Heart Association deliver via USPS mail . Aim 1 : Test feasibility culturally relevant , social medium text-message deliver physical promotion pilot intervention among adult African American woman . The investigator hypothesize culturally relevant Facebook text message deliver intervention feasible measure acceptability , implementation , practicality intervention program . Aim 2 : Examine impact culturally-relevant , Facebook text message deliver intervention increase physical activity enhance associate Social Cognitive Theory construct explicitly target intervention activity . Physical activity objectively measure accelerometer Social Cognitive Theory construct self-efficacy , social support , self-regulation , outcome expectation assess validated self-report questionnaire . The investigator hypothesize participant receive culturally-adapted , Social Cognitive Theory-based Facebook text-message intervention demonstrate high physical activity level great enhancement Social Cognitive Theory construct compare standard print-based intervention group post-intervention assessment . Aim 3 : Examine preliminary effect culturally relevant , social media-delivered physical activity promotion intervention anthropometric , blood pressure , blood lipid outcome . The investigator hypothesize increased physical activity post-intervention follow-up associated improvement variable .
DOC.criteria: selfidentified African American female insufficiently active ( < 150 min/week moderateintensity physical activity assess short version International Physical Activity Questionnaire ) age 2449 year active Facebook account ability read/write English concurrent participation another physical activity promotion program ( research commercial ) pregnant plan become pregnant next 6 month , selfreported condition inhibits engagement physical activity contraindication physical activity accord Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire ( PARQ ) unless write permission participant 's physician engage study provide
